title: Job 33:1
text: WHEREFORE, Job, I pray thee, hear my speeches, and hearken to all my words.

title: Job 33:2
text: Behold, now I have opened my mouth, my tongue hath spoken in my mouth.

title: Job 33:3
text: My words shall be of the uprightness of my heart: and my lips shall utter knowledge clearly.

title: Job 33:4
text: The Spirit of God hath made me, and the breath of the Almighty hath given me life.

title: Job 33:5
text: If thou canst answer me, set thy words in order before me, stand up.

title: Job 33:6
text: Behold, I am according to thy wish in God's stead: I also am formed out of the clay.

title: Job 33:7
text: Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my hand be heavy upon thee.

title: Job 33:8
text: Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,

title: Job 33:9
text: I am clean without transgression, I am innocent; neither is there iniquity in me.

title: Job 33:10
text: Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,

title: Job 33:11
text: He putteth my feet in the stocks, he marketh all my paths.

title: Job 33:12
text: Behold, in this thou art not just: I will answer thee, that God is greater than man.

title: Job 33:13
text: Why dost thou strive against him?  for he giveth not account of any of his matters.

title: Job 33:14
text: For God speaketh once, yea twice, yet man perceiveth it not.

title: Job 33:15
text: In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falleth upon men, in slumberings upon the bed;

title: Job 33:16
text: Then he openeth the ears of men, and sealeth their instruction,

title: Job 33:17
text: That he may withdraw man from his purpose, and hide pride from man.

title: Job 33:18
text: He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.

title: Job 33:19
text: He is chastened also with pain upon his bed, and the multitude of his bones with strong pain:

title: Job 33:20
text: So that his life abhorreth bread, and his soul dainty meat.

title: Job 33:21
text: His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and his bones that were not seen stick out.

title: Job 33:22
text: Yea, his soul draweth near unto the grave, and his life to the destroyers.

title: Job 33:23
text: If there be a messenger with him, an interpreter, one among a thousand, to shew unto man his uprightness:

title: Job 33:24
text: Then he is gracious unto him, and saith, Deliver him from going down to the pit: I have found a ransom.

title: Job 33:25
text: His flesh shall be fresher than a child's: he shall return to the days of his youth:

title: Job 33:26
text: He shall pray unto God, and he will be favourable unto him: and he shall see his face with joy: for he will render unto man his righteousness.

title: Job 33:27
text: He looketh upon men, and if any say, I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not;

title: Job 33:28
text: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.

title: Job 33:29
text: Lo, all these things worketh God oftentimes with man,

title: Job 33:30
text: To bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.

title: Job 33:31
text: Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.

title: Job 33:32
text: If thou hast any thing to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify thee.

title: Job 33:33
text: If not, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.
